intro: Caladenia xantha, commonly known as the golden spider-orchid, is a striking orchid native to south-eastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and its distinctive, spider-like flower with a vivid yellow hue. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats, often in heathlands or open forests. Caladenia xantha is a terrestrial orchid that produces a single, showy flower per stem, which blooms from late winter to early spring. Its unique appearance and habitat make it a notable species within the orchid family.
